title: Weiss Asset Management Settles With SEC Over Short Trades
sub_head: The firm has agreed to pay $6.9 million, including a $200,000 penalty to settle allegations of improper trading
body:
Fund manager Weiss Asset Management in Boston has agreed to pay roughly $6.9 million to settle allegations from the Securities and Exchange Commission that it unlawfully bought securities from public offerings too soon after shorting the same stocks, according to a news release.
The SEC said Weiss violated a rule that bans short selling stocks during a restricted period surrounding a public offering. Weiss miscalculated the periods, with “ill-gotten gains totaling over $6.5 million,” the SEC said.
